actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Subcommittee on Social Security and Family Policy. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 101-1016.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Social Security and Family Policy

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a prototype of a counterfeit-resistant Social Security card, and to provide for a study and report on the development of such card.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a prototype of a counterfeit-resistant social security card which will provide a more reliable means of verifying eligibility for employment under the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 and be suitable for use as a voter registration card. Requires the Secretary to conduct a study and issue a report to the Congress examining different methods of improving the social security card application process. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a prototype of a counterfeit-resistant Social Security card, and to provide for a study and report on the development of such card.
